column1: 00:00|midnight|"""The professor."" Holmes spoke with an exasperated air as he stood up. ""That is his house behind you in the fog. I was keeping watch on the residence myself
column2: last night (usually I have paid Wiggins* to do it)
column3: and all was normal until midnight. It was raw and damp
column4: and I went to the public house down the road for some brandy to warm my insides. While I was gone
column5: two men came to see him. What they said I have no way of knowing
column6: but I don't doubt that they were spies in his pay
column7: come to tell him of my nets closing upon him. When I returned they had gone
column8: and all was as I had left it. Then
column10: I received a wire from Wiggins. Sometime between the time I left and he assumed my place
column11: the professor departed. How or where we have yet to discover. I came here as you saw me lest his friends should lie in ambush."""|"The Seven-Percent Solution"|"Nicholas Meyer"

column1: < 12:00|"almost noon"|"When I awoke it was almost noon. I was covered by Holmes's hound's-tooth travelling cloak
column2: with my legs propped up on the seat. My companion sat across from me as I had left him
column3: staring out the window and smoking his pipe."|"The Seven-Percent Solution"|"Nicholas Meyer"

column1: < 00:00|"Towards midnight"|"Towards midnight Dr. Freud insisted that I try to get some rest
column2: pointing out that I could not possibly be of use to my friend in this
column3: his greatest hour of trial. Unwillingly I returned to my own room."|"The Seven-Percent Solution"|"Nicholas Meyer"
